Elementary Mathematical Functions¶

Generic mathematical functions are provided so that they may be called on something other than numbers, such as grids. When called with CL numbers, they call the equivalent CL function.

function (abs num)¶
function (exp num)¶
function (expt num exponent)¶
function (floor number &optional divisor)¶
function (round number &optional divisor)¶
function (signum a)¶
function (sqrt num)¶

The square root \(\sqrt{x}\) of the generalized or regular number \(x\).

function (= &rest args)¶
function (>= &rest args)¶
function (> &rest args)¶
function (<= &rest args)¶
function (< &rest args)¶
function (minusp a)¶
function (plusp a)¶
function (zerop a)¶
function (+ &rest args)¶

Addition of generalized or regular numbers with an arbitrary number of arguments.

function (- &rest args)¶

Subtraction of generalized or regular numbers.

function (* &rest args)¶

Multiplication of generalized or regular numbers with an arbitrary number of arguments.

function (/ &rest args)¶

Division of generalized or regular numbers for an arbitrary number of arguments.
